name: is-promise
readme: # is-promise Test whether an object looks like a promises-a+ promise [![Build Status](https://img.shields.io/travis/then/is-promise/master.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/then/is-promise) [![Dependency Status](https://img.shields.io/david/then/is-promise.svg)](https://david-dm.org/then/is-promise) [![NPM version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/is-promise.svg)](https://www.npmjs.org/package/is-promise) ## Installation $ npm install is-promise You can also use it client side via npm. ## API ```typescript import isPromise from 'is-promise'; isPromise(Promise.resolve());//=>true isPromise({then:function () {...}});//=>true isPromise(null);//=>false isPromise({});//=>false isPromise({then: true})//=>false ``` ## License MIT
